channel.title: DC Tech Stories
channel.description: DC Tech Stories is a podcast about technical workers in the DC Metro Area.

item.title: Black Code Collective: Building software and community
item.description:
From The Organizers: "We are black software developers creating a welcoming community to grow our skills, share knowledge and help each other progress through our careers. Whether you're just starting out, or you're well along in your career, join us." Email them at blkCodeCollctive@gmail.com!

Organizers: Lougenia Bailey, Emmanuel Apau, Stephon Harris, Malick Diarra, Taylor Poindexter

Twitter: https://twitter.com/blkcodecollctve

Website: http://blackcodecollective.com/

Press:

  • Technically: Talk with Stephon Harris of Black Code Collective

item.title: Brian Jacobs: Digital Storytelling
item.description:
Brian T. Jacobs is a Senior Graphics Editor who designs and develops interactive maps and graphics for National Geographic Magazine. Brian uses visualization and data processing tools to create and envision custom editorial experiences for the web. He was previously a Knight-Mozilla fellow at ProPublica, where he worked on "Losing Ground", an interactive story about the slow-motion environmental catastrophe taking place in southeast Louisiana.

Twitter: http://twitter.com/btjakes

Website: http://briantjacobs.com/

item.title: Joy Whitt: Hackathons, Python, and Justice
item.description:
Joy Whitt is a Program Analyst at the office of the Deputy Mayor for Planning and Economic Development (DMPED), where she works on projects and programs utilizing DC Governmentâ€™s open data. In 2015, she transitioned into a career in tech while learning to code through organizations committed to teaching coding and programming to people of color and women in DC.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/joymwhitt

Website: https://github.com/JoyOfTech

Press:

  • Technically? Meet Joy Whitt

item.title: Vinetta Project: #LadyBoss
item.description:
The Vinetta Project supports female founders in tech by creating unparalleled access to experts, advisors, funding sources, and a community of peers. We bring together founders, funders, and industry influencers to create a dynamic, action-oriented ecosystem. The Vinetta Project launched in DC two years ago. In that time, we have built a powerful network of 800+ tech industry influencers, worked with nearly 200 founders, and engaged over 100 investors. Contact Amelia at amelia@vinettaproject.com for more info!

Twitter: https://twitter.com/vinettaproject

Website: http://dc.vinettaproject.com/

Press:

  • Technically: Vinetta Project
